questions.question: When I opened my eyes, I ………………. a strange sight.
questions.description: We use the simple past tense to talk about two quickly finished actions in the past.

questions.question: Every morning she …………….. up early and gets ready for work.
questions.description: We use the simple present tense to talk about habits and routines.

questions.question: If I knew what he wanted, I ………………. this.
questions.description: We use the second conditional to talk about imaginary situations. In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: I ………………….. anything from her in a long time.
The headmaster ……………… to talk to you.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about facts.

questions.question: Jane ………………. with her parents.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about permanent situations.

questions.question: We ..................... Greece next month.
questions.description: The present continuous tense can be used to talk about future events if the arrangement already exists.

questions.question: The moon …………….. around the earth.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about facts and general truths.

questions.question: She ………………… a novel.
questions.description: We use the present perfect here because there is no reference to time.

questions.question: I …………………. English for twelve years.
questions.description: We use the present perfect continuous tense to talk about actions and situations that started in the past and have continued up to the present.

questions.question: The students ............................. their dialogues.
questions.description: We use the present continuous to talk about actions and situations that are going on at the moment of speaking.
